intro: Sphaerocephalus vaginatus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Sphaerocephalus vaginatus is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
